Sentence: Albatrosses of the biological family Diomedeidae are large seabirds related to the procellariids storm petrels and diving petrels in the order Procellariiformes the tubenoses

Sentence: They range widely in the Southern Ocean and the North Pacific

Sentence: Great albatrosses are among the largest of flying birds with wingspans reaching up to 2535 metres 82115 ft and bodies over 1 metre 33 ft in length

Sentence: The albatrosses are usually regarded as falling into four genera but disagreement exists over the number of species

Sentence: Albatrosses are highly efficient in the air using dynamic soaring and slope soaring to cover great distances with little exertion

Sentence: They feed on squid fish and krill by either scavenging surface seizing or diving

Sentence: Albatrosses are colonial nesting for the most part on remote oceanic islands often with several species nesting together

Sentence: Pair bonds between males and females form over several years with the use of ritualised dances and last for the life of the pair
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: A breeding season can take over a year from laying to fledging with a single egg laid in each breeding attempt
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: A Laysan albatross named Wisdom on Midway Island is the oldestknown wild bird in the world she was first banded in 1956 by Chandler Robbins

Sentence: Of the 22 species of albatrosses recognised by the IUCN 21 are listed as at some level of concern two species are Critically Endangered seven species are Endangered six species are Vulnerable and six species are Near Threatened
Tags: O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Numbers of albatrosses have declined in the past due to harvesting for feathers

Sentence: Albatrosses are threatened by introduced species such as rats and feral cats that attack eggs chicks and nesting adults by pollution by a serious decline in fish stocks in many regions largely due to overfishing and by longline fishing

Sentence: Identified stakeholders such as governments conservation organisations and people in the fishing industry are all working toward reducing this phenomenon

Sentence: Camels do not directly store water in their humps they are reservoirs of fatty tissue
Tags: ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: When this tissue is metabolized it yields a greater mass of water than that of the fat processed
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: This fat metabolization while releasing energy causes water to evaporate from the lungs during respiration as oxygen is required for the metabolic process overall there is a net decrease in water
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Camels have a series of physiological adaptations that allow them to withstand long periods of time without any external source of water
Tags: ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The dromedary camel can drink as seldom as once every 10 days even under very hot conditions and can lose up to 30 of its body mass due to dehydration
Tags: O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Unlike other mammals camels red blood cells are oval rather than circular in shape
Tags: O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: This facilitates the flow of red blood cells during dehydration and makes them better at withstanding high osmotic variation without rupturing when drinking large amounts of water
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Camels are able to withstand changes in body temperature and water consumption that would kill most other mammals
Tags: ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Their temperature ranges from 34 C 93 F at dawn and steadily increases to 40 C 104 F by sunset before they cool off at night again
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: In general to compare between camels and the other livestock camels lose only 13 liters of fluid intake every day while the other livestock lose 20 to 40 liters per day
Tags: O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Maintaining the brain temperature within certain limits is critical for animals to assist this camels have a rete mirabile a complex of arteries and veins lying very close to each other which utilizes countercurrent blood flow to cool blood flowing to the brain
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Camels rarely sweat even when ambient temperatures reach 49 C 120 F
Tags: ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Any sweat that does occur evaporates at the skin level rather than at the surface of their coat the heat of vaporization therefore comes from body heat rather than ambient heat
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Camels can withstand losing 25 of their body weight in water whereas most other mammals can withstand only about 1214 dehydration before cardiac failure results from circulatory disturbance

Sentence: The term crocodile is sometimes used more loosely to include all extant members of the order Crocodilia which includes the alligators and caimans both members of the family Alligatoridae the gharial and false gharial both members of the family Gavialidae as well as other extinct taxa

Sentence: Although crocodiles alligators and the gharial are similar in appearance they belong to separate biological families

Sentence: The gharial with its narrow snout is easier to distinguish while morphological differences are more difficult to spot in crocodiles and alligators
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O

Sentence: The most obvious external differences are visible in the head with crocodiles having narrower and longer heads with a more Vshaped than a Ushaped snout compared to alligators and caimans
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Another obvious trait is that the upper and lower jaws of the crocodiles are the same width and the teeth in the lower jaw fall along the edge or outside the upper jaw when the mouth is closed therefore all teeth are visible unlike an alligator which possesses in the upper jaw small depressions into which the lower teeth fit
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Also when the crocodiles mouth is closed the large fourth tooth in the lower jaw fits into a constriction in the upper jaw
Tags: O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: For hardtodistinguish specimens the protruding tooth is the most reliable feature to define the species family
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Crocodiles have more webbing on the toes of the hind feet and can better tolerate saltwater due to specialized salt glands for filtering out salt which are present but nonfunctioning in alligators

Sentence: Another trait that separates crocodiles from other crocodilians is their much higher levels of aggression

Sentence: However they have many similarities in these areas as well

Sentence: Gulls or colloquially seagulls are seabirds of the subfamily Larinae

Sentence: They are most closely related to terns and skimmers distantly related to auks and even more distantly related to waders

Tags: O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Tags: O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Typically medium to large in size gulls are usually grey or white often with black markings on the head or wings
Tags: O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: They normally have harsh wailing or squawking calls stout longish bills and webbed feet
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Most gulls are groundnesting piscivores or carnivores which take live food or scavenge opportunistically particularly the Larus species
Tags: O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Live food often includes crustaceans molluscs fish and small birds
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Gulls have unhinging jaws that provide the flexibility to consume large prey
Tags: ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Gulls are typically coastal or inland species rarely venturing far out to sea except for the kittiwakes and Sabines gull
Tags: ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL

Sentence: The large species take up to four years to attain full adult plumage but two years is typical for small gulls
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL

Sentence: Large whiteheaded gulls are usually longlived birds with a maximum age of 49 years recorded for the European herring gull
Tags: O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL

Sentence: Gulls nest in large densely packed noisy colonies
Tags: ANIMAL O O O O O O O

Sentence: They lay two or three speckled eggs in nests composed of vegetation
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The young are precocial born with dark mottled down and mobile upon hatching
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Gulls are resourceful inquisitive and intelligent the larger species in particular demonstrating complex methods of communication and a highly developed social structure
Tags: ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: For example many gull colonies display mobbing behaviour attacking and harassing predators and other intruders
Tags: O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Certain species such as the herring gull have exhibited tooluse behaviour for example using pieces of bread as bait with which to catch goldfish
Tags: O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Many species of gulls have learned to coexist successfully with humans and thrive in human habitats

Tags: O O O O O O O O

Tags: ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: They are generally uniform in shape with heavy bodies long wing and moderately long necks

Sentence: Gulls have moderately long legs especially when compared to the similar terns with fully webbed feet

Sentence: The bill is generally heavy and slightly hooked with the larger species having stouter bills than the smaller species

Sentence: Gulls are a generalist species that can thrive in various environments and survive on a widely varied diet

Sentence: The walking gait of gulls includes a slight side to side motion something that can be exaggerated in breeding displays

Sentence: It has a fairly long body with a distinctly thickset and broad back and remarkably loose skin allowing the badger to turn and twist freely within it
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The largest terrestrial mustelid in Africa the honey badger measures 55 to 77 cm 22 to 30 in long and weighs up to 16 kg 35 lb
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Sexual dimorphism has been recorded in this species with males being larger and heavier than females

Sentence: There are two pairs of mammae and an anal pouch which unusual among mustelids is eversible a trait shared with hyenas and mongooses

Sentence: The honey badger is a solitary animal that can be active at any time of day depending on the location

Sentence: It is primarily a carnivorous species and has few natural predators because of its thick skin strength and ferocious defensive abilities

Sentence: Adults maintain large home ranges and display scentmarking behavior

Sentence: The species has no fixed breeding period

Sentence: Its skin is remarkably loose and allows the animal to turn and twist freely within it

Sentence: The eyes are small and the ears are little more than ridges on the skin another possible adaptation to avoiding damage while fighting

Sentence: The honey badger has short and sturdy legs with five toes on each foot

Sentence: Hyenas or hyaenas  hiEEnəz from Ancient Greek ὕαινα hýaina are feliform carnivoran mammals belonging to the family Hyaenidae
Tags: ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: With just four extant species each in its own genus it is the fifthsmallest family in the order Carnivora and one of the smallest in the class Mammalia
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Despite their low diversity hyenas are unique and vital components of most African ecosystems
Tags: O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Although phylogenetically closer to felines and viverrids hyenas are behaviourally and morphologically similar to canids in several elements due to convergent evolution both hyenas and canines are nonarboreal cursorial hunters that catch prey with their teeth rather than claws
Tags: O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Both eat food quickly and may store it and their calloused feet with large blunt nonretractable claws are adapted for running and making sharp turns
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: However hyenas grooming scent marking defecation habits mating and parental behavior are consistent with the behavior of other feliforms
Tags: O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Hyenas feature prominently in the folklore and mythology of human cultures that live alongside them
Tags: ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Hyenas are commonly viewed as frightening and worthy of contempt
Tags: ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: In some cultures hyenas are thought to influence peoples spirits rob graves and steal livestock and children
Tags: O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Other cultures associate them with witchcraft using their body parts in traditional medicine
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Hyenas originated in the jungles of Miocene Eurasia 22 million years ago when most early feliform species were still largely arboreal
Tags: ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The first ancestral hyenas were likely similar to the modern African civet one of the earliest hyena species described Plioviverrops was a lithe civetlike animal that inhabited Eurasia 2022 million years ago and is identifiable as a hyaenid by the structure of the middle ear and dentition
Tags: O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The lineage of Plioviverrops prospered and gave rise to descendants with longer legs and more pointed jaws a direction similar to that taken by canids in North America
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Hyenas then diversified into two distinct types lightly built doglike hyenas and robust bonecrushing hyenas
Tags: ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O ANIMAL

Sentence: Although the doglike hyenas thrived 15 million years ago with one taxon having colonised North America they became extinct after a change in climate along with the arrival of canids into Eurasia
Tags: O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Of the doglike hyena lineage only the insectivorous aardwolf survived while the bonecrushing hyenas including the extant spotted brown and striped hyenas became the undisputed top scavengers of Eurasia and Africa
Tags: O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Rise and fall of the doglike hyenas  The descendants of Plioviverrops reached their peak 15 million years ago with more than 30 species having been identified
Tags: O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Unlike most modern hyena species which are specialised bonecrushers these doglike hyenas were nimblebodied wolfish animals one species among them was Ictitherium viverrinum which was similar to a jackal
Tags: O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The doglike hyenas were numerous in some Miocene fossil sites the remains of Ictitherium and other doglike hyenas outnumber those of all other carnivores combined
Tags: O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O

Sentence: The decline of the doglike hyenas began 57 million years ago during a period of climate change exacerbated by canids crossing the Bering land bridge to Eurasia
Tags: O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: One species Chasmaporthetes ossifragus managed to cross the land bridge into North America being the only hyena to do so
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O

Sentence: Chasmaporthetes managed to survive for some time in North America by deviating from the endurancerunning and bonecrushing niches monopolized by canids and developing into a cheetahlike sprinter
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Most of the doglike hyenas had died off by 15 million years ago
Tags: O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O

Sentence: In addition to the two species in the genus Iguana several other related genera in the same family have common names of the species including the word iguana

Sentence: The species is a popular quarry for pets and nonnative animals have been widely introduced beyond its native area into Ishigaki Island the Florida Peninsula Hawaii Singapore Thailand Taiwan and including numerous islands with native Iguana populations in the Lesser Antilles

Sentence: Iguanas are large lizards that can range from 12 to 20 m 4 to 65 ft in length including their tails
Tags: ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: They possess a dewlap and a row of elongated scales running from the midline of their necks down to their tails
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Iguanas have varying types of scales covering different areas of their body for example some large round tuberculate scales are scattered around the lateral region of the neck among smaller overlapping scales
Tags: ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The scales on the dorsal trunk of their bodies are also thicker and more tightly packed than those on the ventral sides
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: These scales may be a variety of colors and are not always visible from close distances
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: They have a large round scale on their cheeks known as a subtympanic shield
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Iguanas have keen vision and can see shapes shadows colors and movement at long distances
Tags: ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Their visual acuity enables them to navigate through crowded forests and to locate food
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: They employ visual signals to communicate with other members of the same species
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The tympanum the iguanas eardrum is located above the subtympanic shield or ear shield behind each eye

Sentence: As a result of their size Komodo dragons are apex predators and dominate the ecosystems in which they live

Sentence: Komodo dragons hunt and ambush prey including invertebrates birds and mammals

Sentence: Komodo dragons group behavior in hunting is exceptional in the reptile world

Sentence: The diet of Komodo dragons mainly consists of Javan rusa Rusa timorensis though they also eat considerable amounts of carrion

Sentence: Komodo dragons also occasionally attack humans

Sentence: Mating begins between May and August and the eggs are laid in September as many as 20 eggs are deposited at a time in an abandoned megapode nest or in a selfdug nesting hole

Sentence: The eggs are incubated for seven to eight months hatching in April when insects are most plentiful

Sentence: They take 8 to 9 years to mature and are estimated to live up to 30 years

Sentence: Komodo dragons were first recorded by Western scientists in 1910

Sentence: Their large size and fearsome reputation make them popular zoo exhibits

Sentence: In the wild their range has been reduced by human encroachment and is likely to contract further from the effects of climate change hence they are listed as Endangered by the IUCN Red List

Sentence: They are protected under Indonesian law and Komodo National Park was founded in 1980 to aid protection efforts

Sentence: A lemming is a small rodent usually found in or near the Arctic in tundra biomes
Tags: O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Lemmings form the subfamily Arvicolinae also known as Microtinae together with voles and muskrats which form part of the superfamily Muroidea which also includes rats mice hamsters and gerbils
Tags: ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: A longstanding myth holds that they exhibit herd mentality and jump off cliffs committing mass suicide
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Lemmings measure around 1318 cm 57 in in length and weigh around 2334 g 0812 oz
Tags: ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Lemmings are quite rounded in shape with brown and black long soft fur
Tags: ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: They have a very short tail a stubby hairy snout short legs and small ears
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: They have a flattened claw on the first digit of their front feet which helps them to dig in the snow
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: They are herbivorous feeding mostly on mosses and grasses
Tags: O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: They also forage through the snow surface to find berries leaves shoots roots bulbs and lichens
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Lemmings choose their preferred dietary vegetation disproportionately to its occurrence in their habitat
Tags: ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: They digest grasses and sedges less effectively than related voles
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Lemmings do not hibernate through the harsh northern winter
Tags: ANIMAL O O O O O O O O

Sentence: They remain active finding food by burrowing through the snow
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: These rodents live in large tunnel systems beneath the snow in winter which protect them from predators
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Their burrows have rest areas toilet areas and nesting rooms
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: They make nests out of grasses feathers and muskox wool qiviut
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: In the spring they move to higher ground where they live on mountain heaths or in forests continuously breeding before returning in autumn to the tundra
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Like many other rodents lemmings have periodic population booms and then disperse in all directions seeking food and shelter their natural habitats cannot provide
Tags: O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The Norway lemming and West Siberian lemming are two of the few vertebrates which reproduce so quickly that their population fluctuations are chaotic rather than following linear growth to a carrying capacity or regular oscillations
Tags: O O ANIMAL O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Why lemming populations fluctuate with such great variance roughly every four years before numbers drop to near extinction is not known
Tags: O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Lemming behaviour and appearance are markedly different from those of other rodents which are inconspicuously coloured and try to conceal themselves from their predators
Tags: ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Lemmings by contrast are conspicuously coloured and behave aggressively toward predators and even human observers
Tags: ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The lemming defence system is thought to be based on aposematism warning display
Tags: O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Fluctuations in the lemming population affect the behaviour of predators and may fuel irruptions of birds of prey such as snowy owls to areas further south
Tags: O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: For many years the population of lemmings was believed to change with the population cycle but now some evidence suggests their predators populations particularly those of the stoat may be more closely involved in changing the lemming population
Tags: O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O

Sentence: Misconceptions about lemmings go back many centuries
Tags: O O ANIMAL O O O O

Sentence: In 1532 the geographer Jacob Ziegler of Bavaria proposed the theory that the creatures fell out of the sky during stormy weather and then died suddenly when the grass grew in spring
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: This description was contradicted by natural historian Ole Worm who accepted that lemmings could fall out of the sky but claimed that they had been brought over by the wind rather than created by spontaneous generation

Sentence: Worm published dissections of a lemming which showed that they are anatomically similar to most other rodents such as voles and hamsters and the work of Carl Linnaeus proved that they had a natural origin
Tags: O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Tags: ANIMAL O O O O O O

Sentence: Lemurs share resemblance with other primates but evolved independently from monkeys and apes

Sentence: However their braintobody size ratio is smaller than that of anthropoid primates

Sentence: Lemurs are generally the most social of the strepsirrhine primates living in groups known as troops

Sentence: They also have seasonal breeding and female social dominance

Sentence: Two species of lemurs may coexist in the same forest due to different diets

Sentence: Modern studies of lemur ecology and behavior did not begin in earnest until the 1950s and 1960s

Sentence: Mongooses much like goats have narrow ovular pupils

Sentence: The dental formula of mongooses is 313412313412

Sentence: Their modified receptors prevent the snake venom αneurotoxin from binding

Sentence: Monkey is a common name that may refer to most mammals of the infraorder Simiiformes also known as simians
Tags: ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Traditionally all animals in the group now known as simians are counted as monkeys except the apes
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O

Sentence: Thus monkeys in that sense constitute an incomplete paraphyletic grouping however in the broader sense based on cladistics apes Hominoidea are also included making the terms monkeys and simians synonyms in regard to their scope
Tags: O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O

Sentence: In 1812 Étienne Geoffroy grouped the apes and the Cercopithecidae group of monkeys together and established the name Catarrhini Old World monkeys singes de lAncien Monde in French
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O

Sentence: The extant sister of the Catarrhini in the monkey singes group is the Platyrrhini New World monkeys
Tags: O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O ANIMAL

Sentence: Some nine million years before the divergence between the Cercopithecidae and the apes the Platyrrhini emerged within monkeys by migration to South America from AfroArabia the Old World likely by ocean
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Apes are thus deep in the tree of extant and extinct monkeys and any of the apes is distinctly closer related to the Cercopithecidae than the Platyrrhini are
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Many monkey species are treedwelling arboreal although there are species that live primarily on the ground such as baboons
Tags: O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Most species are mainly active during the day diurnal
Tags: O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Monkeys are generally considered to be intelligent especially the Old World monkeys
Tags: ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL

Sentence: Within suborder Haplorhini the simians are a sister group to the tarsiers  the two members diverged some 70 million years ago
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: New World monkeys and catarrhine monkeys emerged within the simians roughly 35 million years ago
Tags: O O ANIMAL O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Old World monkeys and apes emerged within the catarrhine monkeys about 25 million years ago
Tags: O O ANIMAL O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O

Sentence: Extinct basal simians such as Aegyptopithecus or Parapithecus 3532 million years ago are also considered monkeys by primatologists
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O

Sentence: Lemurs lorises and galagos are not monkeys but strepsirrhine primates suborder Strepsirrhini
Tags: O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O

Sentence: The simians sister group the tarsiers are also haplorhine primates however they are also not monkeys
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL

Sentence: Apes emerged within monkeys as sister of the Cercopithecidae in the Catarrhini so cladistically they are monkeys as well
Tags: O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O

Sentence: They can live up to 16 years with their diet mainly consisting of fish and sometimes frogs birds or shellfish depending on the species
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Otters are distinguished by their long slim bodies powerful webbed feet for swimming and their dense fur which keeps them warm and buoyant in water
Tags: ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: They are playful animals engaging in activities like sliding into water on natural slides and playing with stones
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: There are 13 known species of otters ranging in size and habitat preferences with some species adapted to cold waters requiring a high metabolic rate for warmth
Tags: O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Otterhuman interactions have varied over time with otters being hunted for their pelts used in fishing practices in southern Bangladesh and occasionally attacking humans though such incidents are rare and often a result of provocation
Tags: O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Otters hold a place in various cultures mythology and religion symbolizing different attributes and stories from Norse mythology to Native American totems and Asian folklore where they are sometimes believed to possess shapeshifting abilities
Tags: ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The word otter derives from the Old English word otor or oter
Tags: O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: This and cognate words in other IndoEuropean languages ultimately stem from the ProtoIndoEuropean root wódr which also gave rise to the English word water
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: An otters den is called a holt or couch
Tags: O ANIMAL O O O O O O O

Sentence: Male otters are called dogs or boars females are called bitches or sows and their offspring are called pups or cubs
Tags: O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The collective nouns for otters are bevy family lodge romp being descriptive of their often playful nature or when in water raft
Tags: O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The feces of otters are typically identified by their distinctive aroma the smell of which has been described as ranging from freshly mown hay to putrefied fish these are known as spraints

Sentence: Owls are birds from the order Strigiformes  which includes over 200 species of mostly solitary and nocturnal birds of prey typified by an upright stance a large broad head binocular vision binaural hearing sharp talons and feathers adapted for silent flight
Tags: ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Exceptions include the diurnal northern hawkowl and the gregarious burrowing owl
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL

Sentence: Owls are divided into two families the true or typical owl family Strigidae and the barn owl and bay owl family Tytonidae
Tags: ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O ANIMAL O O ANIMAL O O

Sentence: Owls hunt mostly small mammals insects and other birds although a few species specialize in hunting fish
Tags: ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: They are found in all regions of the Earth except the polar ice caps and some remote islands
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: A group of owls is called a parliament
Tags: O O O ANIMAL O O O O

Sentence: Owls possess large forwardfacing eyes and earholes a hawklike beak a flat face and usually a conspicuous circle of feathers a facial disc around each eye
Tags: ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The feathers making up this disc can be adjusted to sharply focus sounds from varying distances onto the owls asymmetrically placed ear cavities
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O

Sentence: Most birds of prey have eyes on the sides of their heads but the stereoscopic nature of the owls forwardfacing eyes permits the greater sense of depth perception necessary for lowlight hunting
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Owls have binocular vision but they must rotate their entire heads to change the focus of their view because like most birds their eyes are fixed in their sockets
Tags: ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Owls are farsighted and cannot clearly see anything nearer than a few centimetres of their eyes
Tags: ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Caught prey can be felt by owls with the use of filoplumeshairlike feathers on the beak and feet that act as feelers
Tags: O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Their far vision particularly in low light is exceptionally good
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Owls can rotate their heads and necks as much as 270
Tags: ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Owls have 14 neck vertebrae  humans have only seven  and their vertebral circulatory systems are adapted to allow them to rotate their heads without cutting off blood to the brain
Tags: ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Specifically the foramina in their vertebrae through which the vertebral arteries pass are about ten times the diameter of the artery instead of about the same size as the artery as is the case in humans the vertebral arteries enter the cervical vertebrae higher than in other birds giving the vessels some slack and the carotid arteries unite in a very large anastomosis or junction the largest of any birds preventing blood supply from being cut off while they rotate their necks
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Other anastomoses between the carotid and vertebral arteries support this effect
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The smallest owlweighing as little as 31 g 1332 oz and measuring some 135 cm 514 inis the elf owl Micrathene whitneyi
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O

Sentence: Around the same diminutive length although slightly heavier are the lesser known longwhiskered owlet Xenoglaux loweryi and Tamaulipas pygmy owl Glaucidium sanchezi
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O

Sentence: The largest owls are two similarly sized eagle owls the Eurasian eagleowl Bubo bubo and Blakistons fish owl Bubo blakistoni
Tags: O O ANIMAL O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O

Sentence: The largest females of these species are 71 cm 28 in long have a 190 cm 75 in wing span and weigh 42 kg 914 lb
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Different species of owls produce different sounds this distribution of calls aids owls in finding mates or announcing their presence to potential competitors and also aids ornithologists and birders in locating these birds and distinguishing species
Tags: O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: As noted above their facial discs help owls to funnel the sound of prey to their ears
Tags: O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: In many species these discs are placed asymmetrically for better directional location
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: An ox pl oxen also known as a bullock in British Australian and Indian English is a large bovine trained and used as a draft animal
Tags: O ANIMAL O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Oxen are commonly castrated adult male cattle because castration inhibits testosterone and aggression which makes the males docile and safer to work with
Tags: ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Cows adult females or bulls intact males may also be used in some areas
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Oxen are used for ploughing for transport pulling carts hauling wagons and even riding for threshing grain by trampling and for powering machines that grind grain or supply irrigation among other purposes
Tags: ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Oxen may be also used to skid logs in forests particularly in lowimpact selectcut logging
Tags: ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Oxen are usually yoked in pairs
Tags: ANIMAL O O O O O

Sentence: Light work such as carting household items on good roads might require just one pair while for heavier work further pairs would be added as necessary
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: A team used for a heavy load over difficult ground might exceed nine or ten pairs
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Oxen are thought to have first been harnessed and put to work around 4000 BC
Tags: ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Working oxen are taught to respond to the signals of the teamster bullocky or oxdriver
Tags: O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The signals are given by oral command and body language reinforced by a goad whip or a long pole which also serves as a measure of length see rod
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: In preindustrial times teamsters were known for their loud voices and forthright language
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: In the New England tradition young castrated cattle selected for draft are known as working steers and are painstakingly trained from a young age
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Their teamster makes or buys as many as a dozen yokes of different sizes for each animal as it grows
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The steers are normally considered fully trained at the age of four and only then become known as oxen
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL

Sentence: A tradition in southeastern England was to use oxen often Sussex cattle as dualpurpose animals for draft and beef
Tags: O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: A plowing team of eight oxen normally consisted of four pairs aged a year apart
Tags: O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Pelicans genus Pelecanus are a genus of large water birds that make up the family Pelecanidae
Tags: ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: They are characterized by a long beak and a large throat pouch used for catching prey and draining water from the scoopedup contents before swallowing
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: They have predominantly pale plumage except for the brown and Peruvian pelicans
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL

Sentence: The bills pouches and bare facial skin of all pelicans become brightly coloured before the breeding season
Tags: O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O

Sentence: The eight living pelican species have a patchy seasonallydependent yet global distribution ranging latitudinally from the tropics to the temperate zone
Tags: O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Pelicans are absent from interior Amazonian South America from polar regions and the open ocean at least one species is known to migrate to the inland desert of Australias Red Centre after heavy rains create temporary lakes
Tags: ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: White pelicans are also observed at the American state of Utahs Great Salt Lake for example some 600 miles 965 km from the nearest coastline the Pacific West Coast
Tags: O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: They have also been seen hundreds of miles inland in North America having flown northwards along the Mississippi River and other large waterways
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Long thought to be related to frigatebirds cormorants tropicbirds and gannets and boobies pelicans instead are most closely related to the shoebill and hamerkop storks although these two birds are not actually true storks and are placed in the order Pelecaniformes
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Ibises spoonbills herons and bitterns have been classified in the same order
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Fossil evidence of pelicans dates back at least 36 million years to the remains of a tibiotarsus recovered from late Eocene strata of Egypt that bears striking similarity to modern species of pelican
Tags: O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL

Sentence: They are thought to have evolved in the Old World and spread into the Americas this is reflected in the relationships within the genus as the eight species divide into Old World and New World lineages
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: This hypothesis is supported by fossil evidence from the oldest pelican taxa
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O

Sentence: Pelicans will frequent inland waterways but are most known for residing along maritime and coastal zones where they feed principally on fish in their large throat pouches diving into the water and catching them atnear the waters surface
Tags: ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: They can adapt to varying degrees of water salinity from freshwater and brackish tomost commonlyseawater
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: They are gregarious birds travelling in flocks hunting cooperatively and breeding colonially
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Four whiteplumaged species tend to nest on the ground and four brown or greyplumaged species nest mainly in trees
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The relationship between pelicans and people has often been contentious
Tags: O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O

Sentence: The birds have been persecuted because of their perceived competition with commercial and recreational fishing
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Their populations have fallen through habitat destruction disturbance and environmental pollution and three species are of conservation concern
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: They also have a long history of cultural significance in mythology and in Christian and heraldic iconography
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The name comes from the Ancient Greek word pelekan πελεκάν which is itself derived from the word pelekys πέλεκυς meaning axe
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: In classical times the word was applied to both the pelican and the woodpecker
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O

Sentence: The genus Pelecanus was first formally described by Carl Linnaeus in his landmark 1758 10th edition of Systema Naturae
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: He described the distinguishing characteristics as a straight bill hooked at the tip linear nostrils a bare face and fully webbed feet
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: This early definition included frigatebirds cormorants and sulids as well as pelicans
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL

Sentence: The family Pelecanidae was introduced as Pelicanea by the French polymath Constantine Samuel Rafinesque in 1815
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Pelicans give their name to the Pelecaniformes an order which has a varied taxonomic history
Tags: ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Tropicbirds darters cormorants gannets boobies and frigatebirds all traditional members of the order have since been reclassified tropicbirds into their own order Phaethontiformes and the remainder into the Suliformes
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: In their place herons ibises spoonbills the hamerkop and the shoebill have now been transferred into the Pelecaniformes
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Molecular evidence suggests that the shoebill and the hamerkop form a sister group to the pelicans though some doubt exists as to the exact relationships among the three lineages
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Penguins are a group of aquatic flightless birds from the family Spheniscidae  of the order Sphenisciformes
Tags: ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: They live almost exclusively in the Southern Hemisphere only one species the Galápagos penguin is found north of the Equator
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O

Sentence: Highly adapted for life in the ocean water penguins have countershaded dark and white plumage and flippers for swimming
Tags: O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Most penguins feed on krill fish squid and other forms of sea life which they catch with their bills and swallow whole while swimming
Tags: O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: A penguin has a spiny tongue and powerful jaws to grip slippery prey
Tags: O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: They spend about half of their lives on land and the other half in the sea
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The largest living species is the emperor penguin Aptenodytes forsteri on average adults are about 11 m 3 ft 7 in tall and weigh 35 kg 77 lb
Tags: O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The smallest penguin species is the little blue penguin Eudyptula minor also known as the fairy penguin which stands around 3033 cm 1213 in tall and weighs 1213 kg 2629 lb
Tags: O O ANIMAL O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Today larger penguins generally inhabit colder regions and smaller penguins inhabit regions with temperate or tropical climates
Tags: O O ANIMAL O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O

Sentence: Some prehistoric penguin species were enormous as tall or heavy as an adult human
Tags: O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: There was a great diversity of species in subantarctic regions and at least one giant species in a region around 2000 km south of the equator 35 mya during the Late Eocene a climate decidedly warmer than today
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The word penguin first appears in literature at the end of the 16th century as a synonym for the great auk
Tags: O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: When European explorers discovered what are today known as penguins in the Southern Hemisphere they noticed their similar appearance to the great auk of the Northern Hemisphere and named them after this bird although they are not closely related
Tags: O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The etymology of the word penguin is still debated
Tags: O O O O O ANIMAL O O O

Sentence: The English word is not apparently of French Breton or Spanish origin the latter two are attributed to the French word pingouin but first appears in English or Dutch
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: An alternative etymology links the word to Latin pinguis which means fat or oil
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Support for this etymology can be found in the alternative Germanic word for penguin fettgans or fatgoose and the related Dutch word vetgans
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Adult male penguins are sometimes called cocks females sometimes called hens a group of penguins on land is a waddle and a group of penguins in the water is a raft
Tags: O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O

Sentence: The birds currently known as penguins were discovered later and were so named by sailors because of their physical resemblance to the great auk
Tags: O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Despite this resemblance however they are not auks and are not closely related to the great auk
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: They do not belong in the genus Pinguinus and are not classified in the same family and order as the great auk
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: They were classified in 1831 by Charles Lucien Bonaparte in several distinct genera within the family Spheniscidae and order Sphenisciformes
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The platypus Ornithorhynchus anatinus sometimes referred to as the duckbilled platypus is a semiaquatic egglaying mammal endemic to eastern Australia including Tasmania
Tags: O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The platypus is the sole living representative or monotypic taxon of its family Ornithorhynchidae and genus Ornithorhynchus though a number of related species appear in the fossil record
Tags: O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Together with the four species of echidna it is one of the five extant species of monotremes mammals that lay eggs instead of giving birth to live young
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Like other monotremes the platypus has a sense of electrolocation which it uses to detect prey in cloudy water
Tags: O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: It is one of the few species of venomous mammals as the male platypus has a spur on the hind foot that delivers an extremely painful venom
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The unusual appearance of this egglaying duckbilled beavertailed otterfooted mammal at first baffled European naturalists
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: In 1799 the first scientists to examine a preserved platypus body judged it a fake made of several animals sewn together
Tags: O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The unique features of the platypus make it important in the study of evolutionary biology and a recognisable and iconic symbol of Australia
Tags: O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: It is culturally significant to several Aboriginal peoples who also used to hunt it for food
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: It has appeared as a national mascot features on the reverse of the Australian twentycent coin and is an emblem of the state of New South Wales
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The platypus was hunted for its fur but it has been a legally protected species in all states where it occurs since 1912
Tags: O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Its population is not under severe threat although captivebreeding programs have had slight success and it is vulnerable to pollution
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: It is classified as a nearthreatened species by the IUCN but a November 2020 report has recommended that it be upgraded to threatened species under the federal EPBC Act due to habitat destruction and declining numbers in all states
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Australian Aboriginal people name or have named the platypus in various ways depending on Australian indigenous languages and dialects
Tags: O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Among the names found boondaburra mallingong tambreet watjarang names in Yass Murrumbidgee and Tumut tohunbuck region of Goomburra Darling Downs dulaiwarrung or dulai warrung Woiwurrung language Wurundjeri Victoria djanbang Bundjalung Queensland djumulung Yuin language Yuin New South Wales maluŋgaŋ ngunnawal language Ngunnawal Australian Capital Territory biladurang wamul dyiimalung oornie dungidany Wiradjuri language Wiradjuri Vic NSW oonah etc
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The name chosen and approved in Palawa kani reconstructed tasmanian language is larila
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: When the platypus was first encountered by Europeans in 1798 a pelt and sketch were sent back to Great Britain by Captain John Hunter the second Governor of New South Wales
Tags: O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: British scientists initial hunch was that the attributes were a hoax
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: George Shaw who produced the first description of the animal in the Naturalists Miscellany in 1799 stated it was impossible not to entertain doubts as to its genuine nature and Robert Knox believed it might have been produced by some Asian taxidermist
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: It was thought somebody had sewn a ducks beak onto the body of a beaverlike animal

Sentence: Porcupines are large rodents with coats of sharp spines or quills that protect them against predation
Tags: ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The term covers two families of animals the Old World porcupines of the family Hystricidae and the New World porcupines of the family Erethizontidae
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O

Sentence: Both families belong to the infraorder Hystricognathi within the profoundly diverse order Rodentia and display superficially similar coats of rigid or semirigid quills which are modified hairs composed of keratin
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Despite this the two groups are distinct from one another and are not closely related to each other within the Hystricognathi
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The largest species of porcupine is the thirdlargest living rodent in the world after the capybara and beaver
Tags: O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The Old World porcupines Hystricidae live in Italy Asia western and southern and most of Africa
Tags: O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: They are large terrestrial and strictly nocturnal
Tags: O O O O O O O

Sentence: About 1900 species of starfish live on the seabed in all the worlds oceans from warm tropical zones to frigid polar regions

Sentence: They are found from the intertidal zone down to abyssal depths at 6000 m 20000 ft below the surface
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Starfish are marine invertebrates

Sentence: They typically have a central disc and usually five arms though some species have a larger number of arms
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The aboral or upper surface may be smooth granular or spiny and is covered with overlapping plates

Sentence: Many species are brightly coloured in various shades of red or orange while others are blue grey or brown

Sentence: Starfish have tube feet operated by a hydraulic system and a mouth at the centre of the oral or lower surface

Sentence: They are opportunistic feeders and are mostly predators on benthic invertebrates

Sentence: They have complex life cycles and can reproduce both sexually and asexually

Sentence: Most can regenerate damaged parts or lost arms and they can shed arms as a means of defense
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The Asteroidea occupy several significant ecological roles
Tags: O O O O O O O

Sentence: Starfish such as the ochre sea star Pisaster ochraceus and the reef sea star Stichaster australis have become widely known as examples of the keystone species concept in ecology
Tags: ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Tags: O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O

Sentence: Only the ossicles and spines of the animal are likely to be preserved making remains hard to locate
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: With their appealing symmetrical shape starfish have played a part in literature legend design and popular culture
Tags: O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: They are sometimes collected as curios used in design or as logos and in some cultures despite possible toxicity they are eaten
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Most starfish have five arms that radiate from a central disc but the number varies with the group
Tags: O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Some species have six or seven arms and others have 1015 arms
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The Antarctic Labidiaster annulatus can have over fifty
Tags: O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Mapping the expression patterns of genes that express differently across the body axes suggests that one could think of the body of a starfish as a disembodied head walking about the sea floor on its lips
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The known markers for trunk structures are expressed only in internal tissues rather than on the surface
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Only the front part of the axis which specifies headrelated structures is represented on the body surface
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The body wall consists of a thin cuticle an epidermis consisting of a single layer of cells a thick dermis formed of connective tissue and a thin coelomic myoepithelial layer which provides the longitudinal and circular musculature
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The dermis contains an endoskeleton of calcium carbonate components known as ossicles
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: These are honeycombed structures composed of calcite microcrystals arranged in a lattice
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: They vary in form with some bearing external granules tubercles and spines but most are tabular plates that fit neatly together in a tessellated manner and form the main covering of the aboral surface
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Some are specialised structures such as the madreporite the entrance to the water vascular system pedicellariae and paxillae
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Pedicellariae are compound ossicles with forcepslike jaws
Tags: O O O O O O O

Sentence: They remove debris from the body surface and wave around on flexible stalks in response to physical or chemical stimuli while continually making biting movements
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: They often form clusters surrounding spines
Tags: O O O O O O

Sentence: Paxillae are umbrellalike structures found on starfish that live buried in sediment
Tags: O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O

Sentence: The edges of adjacent paxillae meet to form a false cuticle with a water cavity beneath in which the madreporite and delicate gill structures are protected
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: All the ossicles including those projecting externally are covered by the epidermal layer
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Several groups of starfish including Valvatida and Forcipulatida possess pedicellariae
Tags: O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O

Sentence: In Forcipulatida such as Asterias and Pisaster they occur in pompomlike tufts at the base of each spine whereas in the Goniasteridae such as Hippasteria phrygiana the pedicellariae are scattered over the body surface
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Some are thought to assist in defence while others aid in feeding or in the removal of organisms attempting to settle on the starfishs surface
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O

Sentence: Some species like Labidiaster annulatus Rathbunaster californicus and Novodinia antillensis use their large pedicellariae to capture small fish and crustaceans
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Throughout the tigers range it inhabits mainly forests from coniferous and temperate broadleaf and mixed forests in the Russian Far East and Northeast China to tropical and subtropical moist broadleaf forests on the Indian subcontinent and Southeast Asia

Sentence: The tiger is an apex predator and preys mainly on ungulates which it takes by ambush

Sentence: It lives a mostly solitary life and occupies home ranges defending these from individuals of the same sex

Sentence: Females give birth to usually two or three cubs that stay with their mother for about two years

Sentence: When becoming independent they leave their mothers home range and establish their own

Sentence: Since the early 20th century tiger populations have lost at least 93 of their historic range and are locally extinct in West and Central Asia in large areas of China and on the islands of Java and Bali

Sentence: Tortoises  TORtəsiz are reptiles of the family Testudinidae of the order Testudines Latin for tortoise

Sentence: Like other turtles tortoises have a shell to protect from predation and other threats

Sentence: They are usually diurnal animals with tendencies to be crepuscular depending on the ambient temperatures

Sentence: Differences exist in usage of the common terms turtle tortoise and terrapin depending on the variety of English being used usage is inconsistent and contradictory

Sentence: These terms are common names and do not reflect precise biological or taxonomic distinctionsThe American Society of Ichthyologists and Herpetologists uses turtle to describe all species of the order Testudines regardless of whether they are landdwelling or seadwelling and uses tortoise as a more specific term for slowmoving terrestrial species

Sentence: General American usage agrees turtle is often a general term tortoise is used only in reference to terrestrial turtles or more narrowly only those members of Testudinidae the family of modern land tortoises and terrapin may refer to turtles that are small and live in fresh and brackish water in particular the diamondback terrapin Malaclemys terrapin

Sentence: British usage by contrast tends not to use turtle as a generic term for all members of the order and also applies the term tortoises broadly to all landdwelling members of the order Testudines regardless of whether they are actually members of the family Testudinidae

Sentence: In Britain terrapin is used to refer to a larger group of semiaquatic turtles than the restricted meaning in America

Sentence: Australian usage is different from both American and British usage

Sentence: Land tortoises are not native to Australia and traditionally freshwater turtles have been called tortoises in Australia

Sentence: Some Australian experts disapprove of this usagebelieving that the term tortoises is better confined to purely terrestrial animals with very different habits and needs none of which are found in this countryand promote the use of the term freshwater turtle to describe Australias primarily aquatic members of the order Testudines because it avoids misleading use of the word tortoise and also is a useful distinction from marine turtles
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Most species of tortoises lay small clutch sizes seldom exceeding 20 eggs and many species have clutch sizes of only 12 eggs
Tags: O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Incubation is characteristically long in most species the average incubation period are between 100 and 1600 days
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Egglaying typically occurs at night after which the mother tortoise covers her clutch with sand soil and organic material
Tags: O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The eggs are left unattended and depending on the species take from 60 to 120 days to incubate
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The size of the egg depends on the size of the mother and can be estimated by examining the width of the cloacal opening between the carapace and plastron
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The plastron of a female tortoise often has a noticeable Vshaped notch below the tail which facilitates passing the eggs
Tags: O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Upon completion of the incubation period a fully formed hatchling uses an egg tooth to break out of its shell
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: It digs to the surface of the nest and begins a life of survival on its own
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: They are hatched with an embryonic egg sac which serves as a source of nutrition for the first three to seven days until they have the strength and mobility to find food
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Juvenile tortoises often require a different balance of nutrients than adults so may eat foods which a more mature tortoise would not
Tags: O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O

Sentence: For example the young of a strictly herbivorous species commonly will consume worms or insect larvae for additional protein
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
