Sentence: Turtles are reptiles of the order Testudines characterized by a special shell developed mainly from their ribs
Tags: ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Modern turtles are divided into two major groups the Pleurodira side necked turtles and Cryptodira hidden necked turtles which differ in the way the head retracts
Tags: O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O

Sentence: There are 360 living and recently extinct species of turtles including landdwelling tortoises and freshwater terrapins
Tags: O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O

Sentence: They are found on most continents some islands and in the case of sea turtles much of the ocean
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O

Sentence: Like other amniotes reptiles birds and mammals they breathe air and do not lay eggs underwater although many species live in or around water
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Turtle shells are made mostly of bone the upper part is the domed carapace while the underside is the flatter plastron or bellyplate
Tags: ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Its outer surface is covered in scales made of keratin the material of hair horns and claws
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The carapace bones develop from ribs that grow sideways and develop into broad flat plates that join up to cover the body
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Turtles are ectotherms or coldblooded meaning that their internal temperature varies with their direct environment
Tags: ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: They are generally opportunistic omnivores and mainly feed on plants and animals with limited movements
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Many turtles migrate short distances seasonally
Tags: O ANIMAL O O O O

Sentence: Sea turtles are the only reptiles that migrate long distances to lay their eggs on a favored beach
Tags: O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Turtles have appeared in myths and folktales around the world
Tags: ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Some terrestrial and freshwater species are widely kept as pets
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Turtles have been hunted for their meat for use in traditional medicine and for their shells
Tags: ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Sea turtles are often killed accidentally as bycatch in fishing nets
Tags: O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Turtle habitats around the world are being destroyed
Tags: ANIMAL O O O O O O O

Sentence: As a result of these pressures many species are extinct or threatened with extinction
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The word turtle is borrowed from the French word tortue or tortre turtle tortoise
Tags: O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O

Sentence: It is a common name and may be used without knowledge of taxonomic distinctions
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: In North America it may denote the order as a whole
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: In Britain the name is used for sea turtles as opposed to freshwater terrapins and landdwelling tortoises
Tags: O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O

Sentence: In Australia which lacks true tortoises family Testudinidae nonmarine turtles were traditionally called tortoises but more recently turtle has been used for the entire group
Tags: O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O

Sentence: The largest living species of turtle and fourthlargest reptile is the leatherback turtle which can reach over 27 m 8 ft 10 in in length and weigh over 500 kg 1100 lb
Tags: O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The largest known turtle was Archelon ischyros a Late Cretaceous sea turtle up to 45 m 15 ft long 525 m 17 ft wide between the tips of the front flippers and estimated to have weighed over 2200 kg 4900 lb
Tags: O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The smallest living turtle is Chersobius signatus of South Africa measuring no more than 10 cm 39 in in length and weighing 172 g 61 oz
Tags: O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The shell of a turtle is unique among vertebrates and serves to protect the animal and provide shelter from the elements
Tags: O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: It is primarily made of 5060 bones and consists of two parts the domed dorsal back carapace and the flatter ventral belly plastron
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: They are connected by lateral side extensions of the plastron
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The carapace is fused with the vertebrae and ribs while the plastron is formed from bones of the shoulder girdle sternum and gastralia abdominal ribs
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: During development the ribs grow sideways into a carapacial ridge unique to turtles entering the dermis inner skin of the back to support the carapace
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The development is signaled locally by proteins known as fibroblast growth factors that include FGF10
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The shoulder girdle in turtles is made up of two bones the scapula and the coracoid
Tags: O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Both the shoulder and pelvic girdles of turtles are located within the shell and hence are effectively within the rib cage
Tags: O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The trunk ribs grow over the shoulder girdle during development
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Vipers are snakes in the family Viperidae found in most parts of the world except for Antarctica Australia Hawaii Madagascar New Zealand Ireland and various other isolated islands
Tags: ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: They are venomous and have long relative to nonvipers hinged fangs that permit deep penetration and injection of their venom
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Three subfamilies are currently recognized
Tags: O O O O O

Sentence: They are also known as viperids
Tags: O O O O O O

Sentence: The name viper is derived from the Latin word vipera ae also meaning viper possibly from vivus living and parere to beget referring to the trait viviparity giving live birth common in vipers like most of the species of Boidae
Tags: O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O

Sentence: All viperids have a pair of relatively long solenoglyphous hollow fangs that are used to inject venom from glands located towards the rear of the upper jaws just behind the eyes
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Each of the two fangs is at the front of the mouth on a short maxillary bone that can rotate back and forth
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: When not in use the fangs fold back against the roof of the mouth and are enclosed in a membranous sheath
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: This rotating mechanism allows for very long fangs to be contained in a relatively small mouth
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The left and right fangs can be rotated together or independently
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: During a strike the mouth can open nearly 180 and the maxilla rotates forward erecting the fangs as late as possible so that the fangs do not become damaged as they are brittle
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The jaws close upon impact and the muscular sheaths encapsulating the venom glands contract injecting the venom as the fangs penetrate the target
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: This action is very fast in defensive strikes it will be more a stab than a bite
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Viperids use this mechanism primarily for immobilization and digestion of prey
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Predigestion occurs as the venom contains proteases which degrade tissues
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Secondarily it is used for self defense though in cases with nonprey such as humans they may give a dry bite not inject any venom
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: A dry bite allows the snake to conserve its precious reserve of venom because once it has been depleted time is needed to replenish it leaving the snake vulnerable
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: In addition to being able to deliver dry bites vipers can inject larger quantities of venom into larger prey targets and smaller amounts into small prey
Tags: O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: This causes the ideal amount of predigestion for the lowest amount of venom
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Almost all vipers have keeled scales a stocky build with a short tail and a triangleshaped head distinct from the neck owing to the location of the venom glands
Tags: O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The great majority have vertically elliptical or slitshaped pupils that can open wide to cover most of the eye or close almost completely which helps them to see in a wide range of light levels
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Typically vipers are nocturnal and ambush their prey
Tags: O ANIMAL O O O O O O

Sentence: Compared to many other snakes vipers often appear rather sluggish
Tags: O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O

Sentence: Most are ovoviviparous the eggs are retained inside the mothers body and the young emerge living
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: However a few lay eggs in nests
Tags: O O O O O O O

Sentence: Typically the number of young in a clutch remains constant but as the weight of the mother increases larger eggs are produced yielding larger young
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Viperid snakes are found in the Americas Africa Eurasia and South Asia
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: In the Americas they are native from south of 48N
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: In the Old World viperids are located everywhere except Siberia Ireland and north of the Arctic Circle in Norway and Sweden
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Wild viperids are not found in Australia
Tags: O O O O O O O

Sentence: The common adder a viperid is the only venomous snake found in Great Britain
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Viperid venoms typically contain an abundance of proteindegrading enzymes called proteases that produce symptoms such as pain strong local swelling and necrosis blood loss from cardiovascular damage complicated by coagulopathy and disruption of the bloodclotting system
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Also being vasculotoxic in nature viperine venom causes vascular endothelial damage and hemolysis
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Death is usually caused by collapse in blood pressure
Tags: O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: This is in contrast to elapid venoms which generally contain neurotoxins that disable muscle contraction and cause paralysis
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Death from elapid bites usually results from asphyxiation because the diaphragm can no longer contract but this rule does not always apply some elapid bites include proteolytic symptoms typical of viperid bites while some viperid bites produce neurotoxic symptoms
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Proteolytic venom is also dualpurpose first it is used for defense and to immobilize prey as with neurotoxic venoms second many of the venoms enzymes have a digestive function breaking down molecules such as lipids nucleic acids and proteins
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: This is an important adaptation as many vipers have inefficient digestive systems
Tags: O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O

Sentence: A vulture is a bird of prey that scavenges on carrion
Tags: O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: There are 23 extant species of vulture including condors
Tags: O O O O O O ANIMAL O O

Sentence: Old World vultures include 16 living species native to Europe Africa and Asia New World vultures are restricted to North and South America and consist of seven identified species all belonging to the Cathartidae family
Tags: O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: A particular characteristic of many vultures is a bald unfeathered head
Tags: O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O

Sentence: This bare skin is thought to keep the head clean when feeding and also plays an important role in thermoregulation
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Vultures have been observed to hunch their bodies and tuck in their heads in the cold and open their wings and stretch their necks in the heat
Tags: ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: They also urinate on themselves as a means of cooling their bodies
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: A group of vultures in flight is called a kettle while the term committee refers to a group of vultures resting on the ground or in trees
Tags: O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O

Sentence: A group of vultures that are feeding is termed a wake
Tags: O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O

Sentence: Although New World vultures and Old World vultures share many resemblances they are not very closely related
Tags: O O O ANIMAL O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Rather they share resemblance because of convergent evolution
Tags: O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Early naturalists placed all vultures under one single biological group
Tags: O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O

Sentence: Carl Linnaeus had assigned both Old World vultures and New World vultures in a Vultur genus even including the harpy eagle
Tags: O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Soon anatomists split Old and New World vultures with New World vultures being placed in a new suborder Cathartae later renamed Cathartidae as per the Rules of Nomenclature from Greek carthartes meaning purifier by French ornithologist Frédéric de Lafresnaye
Tags: O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The suborder was later recognised as a family rather than a suborder
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: In the late 20th century some ornithologists argued that New World vultures are more closely related to storks on the basis of karyotype morphological and behavioral data
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Thus some authorities placed them in the Ciconiiformes family with storks and herons Sibley and Monroe 1990 even considered them a subfamily of the storks
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: This was criticized and an early DNA sequence study was based on erroneous data and subsequently retracted
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: There was then an attempt to raise the New World vultures to the rank of an independent order Cathartiformes not closely associated with either the birds of prey or the storks and herons
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Wagtails are a group of passerine birds that form the genus Motacilla in the family Motacillidae
Tags: ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The common name and genus name are derived from their characteristic tail pumping behaviour
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Together with the pipits and longclaws they form the family Motacillidae
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The forest wagtail belongs to the monotypic genus Dendronanthus which is closely related to Motacilla and sometimes included therein
Tags: O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The willie wagtail Rhipidura leucophrys of Australia is not a true wagtail it was named as such by early settlers from England from its superficial similarity in colour and behaviour to the pied wagtail but belongs to an unrelated genus of birds known as fantails
Tags: O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The genus Motacilla was described by the Swedish naturalist Carl Linnaeus in 1758 in the tenth edition of his Systema Naturae
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The type species is the white wagtail
Tags: O O O O O O ANIMAL

Sentence: Motacilla is the Latin name for the pied wagtail although actually a diminutive of motare to move about from medieval times it led to the misunderstanding of cilla as tail
Tags: O O O O O O O O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: At first glance the wagtails appear to be divided into a yellowbellied group and a whitebellied one or one where the upper head is black and another where it is usually grey but may be olive yellow or other colours

Sentence: Whales are a widely distributed and diverse group of fully aquatic placental marine mammals

Sentence: Dolphins and porpoises may be considered whales from a formal cladistic perspective

Sentence: Whales dolphins and porpoises belong to the order Cetartiodactyla which consists of eventoed ungulates
Tags: ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Their closest noncetacean living relatives are the hippopotamuses from which they and other cetaceans diverged about 54 million years ago
Tags: O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: The two parvorders of whales baleen whales Mysticeti and toothed whales Odontoceti are thought to have had their last common ancestor around 34 million years ago

Sentence: Odontocetes include the Monodontidae belugas and narwhals Physeteridae the sperm whale Kogiidae the dwarf and pygmy sperm whale and Ziphiidae the beaked whales as well as the six families of dolphins and porpoises which are not considered whales in the informal sense

Tags: ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Some species such as sperm whales are particularly well adapted for diving to great depths to catch squid and other favoured prey

Sentence: The wolf Canis lupus pl wolves also known as the grey wolf or gray wolf is a canine native to Eurasia and North America

Sentence: The wolf is the largest wild extant member of the family Canidae and is further distinguished from other Canis species by its less pointed ears and muzzle as well as a shorter torso and a longer tail
Tags: O ANIMAL O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Sentence: Of all members of the genus Canis the wolf is most specialized for cooperative game hunting as demonstrated by its physical adaptations to tackling large prey its more social nature and its highly advanced expressive behaviour including individual or group howling

Sentence: Single wolves or mated pairs typically have higher success rates in hunting than do large packs

Sentence: Pathogens and parasites notably the rabies virus may infect wolves

Sentence: Woodpeckers piculets and wrynecks all possess characteristic zygodactyl feet consisting of four toes the first hallux and the fourth facing backward and the second and third facing forward

Sentence: This foot arrangement is good for grasping the limbs and trunks of trees

Sentence: Members of this family can walk vertically up tree trunks which is beneficial for activities such as foraging for food or nest excavation

Sentence: In addition to their strong claws and feet woodpeckers have short strong legs

Sentence: This is typical of birds that regularly forage on trunks

Sentence: The tails of all woodpeckers except the piculets and wrynecks are stiffened and when the bird perches on a vertical surface the tail and feet work together to support it

Sentence: Woodpeckers have strong bills that they use for drilling and drumming on trees and long sticky tongues for extracting food insects and larvae

Sentence: The bills chisellike tip is kept sharp by the pecking action in birds that regularly use it on wood

Sentence: The beak consists of three layers an outer sheath called rhamphotheca made of scales formed from keratin proteins an inner layer of bone which has a large cavity and mineralised collagen fibers and a middle layer made of porous bone which connects the two other layers

Sentence: Combined this anatomy helps the beak absorb mechanical stress
